title: 103_hr58
content: The Act titled "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" includes provisions for the conveyance of vessels. The Secretary of Transportation may convey 2 vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials to merchant mariners. Vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be scheduled for scrapping. Organizations must enter into an agreement before receiving the vessels. The Secretary of Transportation can transfer vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials to merchant mariners. The vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be scheduled for scrapping. Organizations must agree to sell the vessel for scrap, use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship, and return any unused proceeds to the United States. The Secretary of Transportation can transfer vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials to merchant mariners. Vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be scheduled for scrapping. Organizations must sell the vessel for scrap, use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship, and return any unused proceeds to the United States. Amounts returned to the US shall be deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. Vessels will be delivered at their location, in their current condition, and at no cost to the Government. The Secretary will deliver vessels to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials in their current condition and at no cost to the Government. The authority to convey vessels expires 2 years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers: ARIEL, BRANDARIS, COMPASS ROSE, DIXIE, ELISSA, EMERALD PRINCESS, ENTERPRISE, EUROPA STAR, EUROPA SUN, GAZELA OF PHILADELPHIA, GRAY, GRIZZLY PROCESSOR, GUSTO. The vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers are: GYPSY COWBOY, IMPATIENT LADY, ISLAND GIRL, JULIET, KALENA, LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, and LISERON. The vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers are: MARINE STAR, MARINER, MARY B, MOONSHINE, MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, PANDACEA, and PELICAN. The vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers are: MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, PANDACEA, PELICAN, PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, SABLE, SERENA, SHILOH, SIDEWINDER, SWELL DANCER, and TESSA. Foreign-flag vessel H851, with official number 286080, is permitted to engage in coastwise trade to transport an offshore drilling platform jacket from near Aransas Pass, Texas, to a designated site. Foreign-flag vessel H851 is authorized to transport an offshore drilling platform jacket from near Aransas Pass, Texas, to Viosca Knoll 989 on the Outer Continental Shelf. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE for coastwise and Great Lakes trade. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE with coastwise and Great Lakes endorsements. Additionally, the Secretary may issue a certificate for the vessel M/V TWIN DRILL with a coastwise endorsement after a major conversion in a U.S. shipyard costing more than 3 times the vessel's purchase value. The vessel must undergo a major conversion in a U.S. shipyard costing more than 3 times its purchase value, be documented under chapter 121 of title 46 with a coastwise endorsement before June 30, 1995, and the person must contract with a U.S. shipyard to construct an additional vessel of equal or greater capacity within 12 months for delivery within 36 months. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels REEL CLASS and DA WARRIOR with specific endorsements, bypassing certain regulations. The vessels UST ATLANTIC and UST PACIFIC can be sold to non-US citizens and registered under a foreign registry. The vessel AMY CHOUEST is considered to be less than 500 gross tons for US maritime laws. The Secretary of Commerce may deploy a Physical Ocean Real-Time System in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel for nautical charting and marine safety improvements. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a 3-year pilot program for Sealift Training at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy.
